text: The Electoral district of Monmouth was a single-member electoral district of the Tasmanian House of Assembly. It was based in the rural hinterland to the north of the state capital, Hobart. The seat was created in a redistribution ahead of the 1903 state election out of the former seats of Brighton and Richmond, and was abolished when the Tasmanian parliament adopted the Hare- Clark electoral model in 1909. It had a single member during its existence, Thomas Hodgman. ==Members for Monmouth== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Term |- | | Thomas Hodgman | 1903–1909 |} ==See also== *Monmouth Land District ==References== * * * Parliament of Tasmania (2006). The Parliament of Tasmania from 1956 Monmouth
title: Electoral district of Monmouth
